For the halibut: salt and freshly ground black pepper
125g/4½oz Japanese panko breadcrumbs, or use brioche breadcrumbs
For the sauce: 2.5cm/1in piece fresh ginger, cut into matchsticks

steps: For the halibut, brush the halibut steaks with a little oil and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Press the breadcrumbs onto both sides of the fish.
Heat a little oil in a pan and fry the halibut steaks over a medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown and cooked through. Set aside in a warm place.
For the sauce, heat the oil in the same pan used to cook the fish, add the shallots, garlic and ginger and fry gently for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add the cherry tomatoes and cook until they begin to burst open, then add the red wine vinegar, sugar, ketchup and fish sauce and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
To serve, place the halibut steaks onto serving plates and spoon over the sauce. Garnish with coriander and shredded spring onions and serve with jasmine rice.
title: Sweet and sour halibut
